column4: Daimler teams up with China's Baidu in connected cars drive
column5: FRANKFURT German carmaker Daimler is to make software from web services company Baidu available in its Chinese Mercedes-Benz cars as part of a trend of deepening ties between carmakers and consumer technology companies.

column4: Charter Communications nears $55 billion deal for Time Warner Cable - sources
column5: Time Warner Cable Inc is nearing an agreement to be acquired by smaller peer Charter Communications Inc for about $55 billion  combining the second and third largest U.S. cable operators  people familiar with the matter said on Monday.

column4: UPDATE 4-Charter Communications nears $55 bln deal for Time Warner Cable - sources
column5: May 25 Time Warner Cable Inc is nearing an agreement to be acquired by smaller peer Charter Communications Inc for about $55 billion  combining the second and third largest U.S. cable operators  people familiar with the matter said on Monday.

column4: Charter nears deal for Time Warner Cable at $195/shr -sources
column5: May 25 Charter Communications Inc is near an agreement to acquire Time Warner Cable Inc for $195 per share in cash and stock  a person familiar with the matter said on Monday.

column4: Alibaba's latest gambit in fighting fakes: foster local brands
column5: PUTIAN  China Criticized and even sued by luxury brand Gucci and others for facilitating the counterfeit goods trade  Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba Group Holding Ltd has been quietly piloting a scheme to try to curb fakes at source.

column4: Bancolombia ready to finance up to $5 billion in infrastructure
column5: BOGOTA Bancolombia  Colombia's largest bank by assets  is ready to finance up to $5 billion in infrastructure projects in the Andean country  bank president Carlos Raul Yepes said on Monday.

column4: UPDATE 2-Barrick sells Australian Cowal gold mine to Evolution for $550 mln
column5: * Deal will boost Evolution's gold output to 800 000 ounce/year

column4: Barrick agrees to sell Cowal mine for $550 mln
column5: NEW YORK  May 24 Barrick Gold Corp said on Sunday that it had reached an agreement to sell 100 percent of the Cowal mine in New South Wales  Australia to Evolution Mining for $550 million.

column4: CNRL cuts Kirby South oil sands production due to Alberta fire
column5: CALGARY  Alberta  May 25 Canadian Natural Resources Ltd has cut production at its Kirby South oil sands project to 12 000 barrels per day from 30 000 bpd due to a wildfire raging in northeastern Alberta  a company spokeswoman said on Monday.

column4: UPDATE 2-Wildfire shuts down about 9 pct of Alberta crude output
column5: CALGARY  Alberta  May 25 A wildfire raging in northeastern Alberta has shut down around 233 000 barrels per day (bpd) of production at three oil sands projects and is expected to remain out of control for "some while yet " a provincial government spokesman said on Monday.

column4: Bangladesh Islamic State suspect worked for Coca-Cola unit: sources
column5: DHAKA One of two men arrested in Bangladesh as a suspected member of Islamic State was an IT manager at a subsidiary of Coca-Cola Co  police and company sources told Reuters on Monday.

column4: Bangladesh Islamic State suspect worked for Coca-Cola unit - sources
column5: DHAKA  May 25 One of two men arrested in Bangladesh as a suspected member of Islamic State was an IT manager at a subsidiary of Coca-Cola Co  police and company sources told Reuters on Monday.

column4: Greek  French  Italian shares fall in thin trading
column5: * Sentiment also worsens on hints of U.S. rate hike this year

column4: Goldman Sachs targets $1 billion in Japan renewable energy bonds
column5: TOKYO Goldman Sachs Group Inc  plans to establish a bond facility to target $1 billion in investment within the next few years in renewable energy projects in Japan  people familiar with the plan said.

column4: Goldman Sachs targets $1 bln in Japan renewable energy bonds
column5: TOKYO  May 25 Goldman Sachs Group Inc  plans to establish a bond facility to target $1 billion in investment within the next few years in renewable energy projects in Japan  people familiar with the plan said.

column4: Hilton shares could rise 25 pct in the next year: Barron's
column5: NEW YORK Hilton Worldwide Holdings  shares could rise another 25 percent over the next year due to its expansion drive and rising room revenue  according to Barron's financial newspaper.

column4: Hilton shares could rise 25 pct in the next year - Barron's
column5: NEW YORK  May 24 Hilton Worldwide Holdings  shares could rise another 25 percent over the next year due to its expansion drive and rising room revenue  according to Barron's financial newspaper.

column4: Israeli regulator to resign  may free up gas explorers Noble and Delek
column5: JERUSALEM  May 25 Israel's anti-monopoly regulator  who has been pushing to open the energy sector to competition  said on Monday he would step down in August  potentially lifting the pressure on exploration companies Noble Energy and Delek Group.

column4: Ryder shares could rise 30 percent in a year - Barron's
column5: May 25 Ryder System Inc's shares could rise 30 percent in a year as the truck rental company continues to attract first-time leases and expands its out-sourced maintenance services  Barron's financial newspaper said in its latest issue.
